gt_metadata.revision_notes: v3.0: Tier changes: GT-06: T2 -> T3. Previous: 2.4_corrected_2026-01-14_v3_LOCKED

ground_truth.issue: Unilateral price and discount changes with short notice
key_elements: Vendor can modify prices, discounts, or product offerings
No right to terminate on unacceptable increase
Right to terminate if increase unacceptable
ground_truth.contract_text: Vendor may modify prices, discounts, or product offerings at any time upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice to Reseller. Price changes shall apply to orders placed after the effective date of such changes.

ground_truth.issue: No termination for convenience during Term
key_elements: Neither party can terminate for convenience during 2-year initial term
Locked in even if relationship not working
Should add mutual TfC right on reasonable notice
ground_truth.contract_text: This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial term of two (2) years. Thereafter, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year periods unless either Party provides written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days prior to the end of the then-current term. Neither Party may terminate this Agreement for convenience during the Term.

key_elements: Vendor liability capped at 12 months of Reseller purchases
No carve-outs for IP infringement, willful misconduct
May be insufficient for significant claims
ground_truth.contract_text: VENDOR'S TOTAL LIABILITY SHALL NOT EXCEED AMOUNTS PAID BY RESELLER IN THE TWELVE MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM.

key_elements: Vendor disclaims all warranties beyond basic performance
Only warrants 'substantially as described in documentation'
ground_truth.contract_text: Vendor warrants that the Products will perform substantially as described in documentation. Vendor's warranty obligations to End Users are set forth in the EULA. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH HEREIN, VENDOR MAKES NO WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND.

ground_truth.issue: Non-exclusive appointment with Vendor direct sales
key_elements: Vendor reserves right to sell directly
Should negotiate exclusive territory or customer segment
Limit direct Vendor competition on Reseller-sourced leads
ground_truth.contract_text: Vendor hereby appoints Reseller as a non-exclusive, authorised reseller of the Products within the Territory... Vendor reserves the right to sell Products directly and to appoint other resellers within the Territory.

key_elements: Should reduce to 1% or prime + margin
ground_truth.contract_text: Reseller shall pay all invoices within thirty (30) days of invoice date. Late payments bear interest at 1.5% per month.

ground_truth.issue: Vendor can require prepayment on credit issues
key_elements: Vendor can require prepayment if credit limits exceeded
Can require prepayment on past-due balances
ground_truth.contract_text: Vendor may establish and modify credit limits for Reseller. Vendor may require prepayment if Reseller exceeds credit limits or has past-due balances.

ground_truth.issue: Sales reports require End User information
key_elements: Quarterly reports must include End User information
Could enable Vendor to go direct
Add confidentiality for End User data
ground_truth.contract_text: Reseller shall provide quarterly reports detailing Products sold, End User information, and sales pipeline. Reports are due within fifteen (15) days after each quarter end.

key_elements: Neither party liable for indirect/consequential damages
Blocks recovery for lost profits, business interruption
Should add carve-outs for IP infringement
ground_truth.contract_text: NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES.

key_elements: Reseller must cease marketing and selling IMMEDIATELY
NO inventory sell-off period (unlike Distribution/License which have 90 days)
Add transition support and customer handover
ground_truth.contract_text: Upon termination: (a) Reseller shall cease marketing and selling Products; (b) Reseller shall pay all outstanding amounts; (c) trademark licenses shall terminate.

key_elements: No IP infringement indemnification from Vendor
Reseller exposed to End User claims for software defects
Critical for software resale - End Users will sue Reseller
Should add Vendor indemnification for IP claims
Add indemnification for product defects and EULA breaches
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No indemnification clause exists in contract

key_elements: May handle End User personal data in sales process
No data security obligations from Vendor
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No data protection or privacy provisions exist in contract. Note: 8.1 requires Reseller to report 'End User information' to Vendor.

ground_truth.issue: Support SLAs Missing - No Service Level Commitments
key_elements: 7.2 references Vendor support but no SLA defined
No escalation path for critical issues
Reseller cannot make commitments to End Users
Should add remedies for SLA breach (credits, termination right)
ground_truth.contract_text: 7.2 Vendor shall provide technical support for the Products in accordance with Vendor's then-current support policies. [No SLA metrics defined]

issues: GT-03 (12.2 - Vendor liability cap too low)
GT-08 (8.1 - Sales reports require End User)
GT-12 (N/A (Missing) - No Data Protection / Privacy C)
GT-13 (7.2 - Support SLAs Missing - No Serv)
GT-06 (5.1 - High late payment interest rat)

v2.1_changes: Promoted missing indemnification to T1 (critical for software resale)
Added GT-05 for non-exclusivity (was missing - significant for Reseller)
Demoted GT-07 prepayment to T3 (standard credit management)
Confirmed 9.3 has NO sell-off period - verified against contract text
Renumbered GT items for logical flow
contract_verification: 9.3 verified: Only lists (a) cease marketing, (b) pay amounts, (c) trademark terminates - NO sell-off
2.1/2.2 verified: Non-exclusive with Vendor direct sales rights
No indemnification article exists in Articles 1-13
